intro: Selenodesmium elongatum subsp. queenslandicum, commonly known as the Queensland selenodesmium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
